title.narrative: EA 19/2017 Emergency Response to the humanitarian crisis in Venezuela

description.narrative: The humanitarian crisis in Venezuela is worsening as increasing food, nutrition and medicine shortages, soaring inflation levels, the collapse of the health system and violence leave the population without access to nutrition, medical care or basic public services. 82% of Venezuelans currently live in poverty. Cumulative annual inflation is 700%, the highest in the world, and the IMF has projected a 1200% increase for next year. Specific food inflation, reflected by the state's food program, was 833% last year. Health is deteriorating due to a severe shortage of pharmaceuticals of more than 85%. This situation has led to a resurgence of diseases that were thought to have been eradicated, in particular: malaria, diphtheria and tuberculosis. Acute malnutrition in children under 5 years has tripled in less than 2 years and exceeds the level allowable by the World Health Organization (WHO). The Current Emergency Appeal aims to increase the access of the Venezuelan population to medicines, nutritional supplements and complementary food, in addition to restoring and rehabilitating the potential of organizations and communities through the strengthening of their capacities.
